message: I've used Git but it's got a learning curve for new designers. Dropbox is awesome, but you need to pay a lot for the team plan. I'd like something with some sort of *easy* version control that's accessible by everyone, even if they don't use Adobe products. What do you guys use?
inside that I keep a fireworks file per projects with every illustration element I've made
We have a misc art folder
Then secondary levels only get heavy with subfolders if needed. For instance, if we have a lot of different types of layouts - http://screencast.com/t/drJNFoW8

My assets folder at home is better structured than the one here. At home it has the following subfolders: ui icons, form elements, backgrounds, textures, brushes, grid systems, stock photos, stock vector, and so on
@nickgassmann Mind sharing what your structure looks like, specifically? :)

I like the idea of using something like http://sparkleshare.org/, but it's still really new. It also doesn't solve my problem, which I don't think I can solve without UI that.. well, just doesn't exist. Thanks for the feedback so far.
